name: 郭志宇
objective: Engineering Mathematics (II) will be divided into four parts: (1)  Fourier analysis, (2) Partial Differential Equations, (3) vector differential and integral calculus.
schedule:
1st    Fourier Series, Half-Range Expansions 
2nd   Fourier Integral (Feb 28th break)
3rd   Fourier Integral
4th    Orthogonal Functions
5th    Orthogonal Eigenfunction Expansions
6th   Orthogonal Eigenfunction Expansions
7th    First Midterm Exam
8th   Partial Differential Equations: Basic Concepts, Wave Function
9th    Heat Equation: Solution by Separating Variables
10th   Heat Equation: Solution by Separating Variables
11th  Laplace’s Equation in Cylindrical and Spherical Coordinates. Potential
12th  Laplace’s Equation in Cylindrical and Spherical Coordinates. Potential
13th  Second Midterm Exam
14th Vector Differential Calculus
15th  Vector Differential Calculus
16th  Vector Integral Calculus 
17th   Vector Integral Calculus 
18th  Final Exam
scorePolicy:
1. Present/absent 15%
2. Homework 25% total
3. Midterm, final term 20% each 60% total
materials: Kreyszig, E., Advanced Engineering Mathematics, 10th Ed., John Wiley & Sons, Singapore (2018).
